title: Why do Christians Gather for Worship on Sunday instead of Saturday. The Fourth Commandment
description:
Growing up in the Christian Reformed Church meant my family had some strange "Sabbath" traditions. It was difficult for me to understand why we did this on Sunday. As a church we would even read the 10 commandments and it clearly says "Sabbath" 

The evolution of Jewish Sabbath observance to Christian Sunday observance is a long one. I give a fast tracing of that through to today. I also believe that the Heidelberg Catechism gets the transformation correct in terms of how Christian Sunday celebration of the resurrection both connects us with the Genesis creation story through the development of Christian worship replacing Synagogue worship and in anticipation of the "eternal Sabbath rest". 

The Lost World of Genesis 1 https://amzn.to/2GPjXss
The Heidelberg Catechism https://www.crcna.org/welcome/beliefs/confessions/heidelberg-catechism

Click here to meetup with other channel viewers for conversation https://discord.gg/jdVk8XU 

Vanderklips channel https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCX0jIcadtoxELSwehCh5QTg

If you want to schedule a one-on-one conversation check here. https://paulvanderklay.me/2019/08/06/converzations-with-pvk/

For the audio podcast mirror on Podbean http://paulvanderklay.podbean.com/

To listen to this on ITunes https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/paul-vanderklays-podcast/id1394314333 

If you need the RSS feed for your podcast player https://paulvanderklay.podbean.com/feed/
